item.description:
Join the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Sunday evening to observe the flight of the Timberdoodle, the American Woodcock.  We will begin with a gathering at a campfire with hotdogs at the amphitheater behind the headquarters building in Carver beginning around 5:00 PM. 

No dogs tonight please. But bring the kids they will love this!
BBQ Information  Starting around 5:00 PM, we will light a campfire in the amphitheater behind the Headquarters. We will provide veggie dogs and hot dogs but you have to cook them yourself using the ol'-stick method. We will also have coleslaw, baked beans, cookies and drinks. If you plan to eat with us, please donate a few dollars to cover the cost of the food and please add an extra dollar or two to help us pay for this meetup.com site.
Do you know how to build a campfire? If yes, come at 4:15 PM and help Sharl set the fire.


Around 6:00 PM. we will car pool to the fields on Cutter Field Road where Glenn d'Entremont, our bird guru, will lead us as we listen to and observe the flight display of the American Woodcock.  At this time of year these plump "shorebirds" with the funky bill and eyes which seem not to look forward arrive from the south and the males display for the females by performing an elaborate circular flight display and return to earth at the same spot where it began!  After it gets dark we can listen for owls, if the group wants to.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Woodcock Walk
